column4: oh ... that wouldn't work .... you need something to forward the graphics ..
I got the one about enableing remote desktop, however, I have no way of getting a monitor connected to the server
but is it installed? I need to actually install ubuntu on the server :)
freenxis pretty awesome actually.

,for quite some time I have been trying to figure out the ways I can access a remote computer's GUI ... I wanted a fast and neat solution.. freenx was it .. I tried SSH- X forwards, XDMCP, various VNC servers....
What I could do is try to enable vnc by hitting Alt + Ctrl F1 on the keyboard and blindly start something
the problem with VNC it is needs a GUI running on the remote machine.
the desktop installer has X
so I need to enable vnc by blindly entering something in the shell
if someone finds out what I need to enter to enable desktop sharing on the live cd I would be able to install over vnc
yeah but by blindly entering something I doubt if you would be able to correctly tell it what server to share (VNC) .. you will have to login to the gdm ..
the desktop install cd automagically boots into a loggedin gnome session
ah .. you are right ..
yes :) which leads me to believe there is a way to install :]
good luck with that .... I sincerely doubt if you would be able to do that.. but if you could awsome
this is something that is possible in knoppix  http://www.knoppix.net/wiki/Hd_Install_Without_a_Monitor_HowTo
thanks, it's a 2,4ghz server so I'll keep trying
I know the default VNC server is called 'vino' so perhaps some manual pages might have something
thanks
i'll boot it up in vmware and play
lol, turns out there's more trouble, I can only boot from floppy :P
